review_title: Watch out! this game is not cross-buy!
one_reviews_text:
The game itself is okay but every game i bought sofar on my quest 2 i can also play on my pc. I asumed this was the case with red matter aswell. I will update stars when cross buy.

edit #1: The game itself is fun and has nice mechanics but 3 hours experience for 25 euro thats criminal. And i am a slow player.
I thought this was a great game. Very immersive.

This game was challenging in a few places but not too hard to figure out. Great graphics, storyline, and length! There’s a couple of freaky things that can make your heart race but that just made it interesting. 
I love how many options there are, I prefer to teleport but there’s also smooth gliding walking options too. 
There are some achievements to earn along the way and I loved the immense atmosphere in every scene you play. 
Get this game, it’s worth it!
The game is pretty good visualy, but the puzzles are dull, story isnt all that engaging and gameplay is lacking. i still recomend though. looks really good

this is one of the best games ive ever played when it comes to puzzles and mysteries I say that because it is so fun to figure everything out and its really well put together. and its also a bit creepy but in a good way.

review_title: You need a Brain not guns.
one_reviews_text: First game I have completed in VR Loved it. Nice slow pace with amazing settings. Slighty creepy in places, but no jump scares. Hope that Vertical Robot make another game soon.

The setting is amazing. You really feel alone in a space station solving a mystery that pulls you down a rabbit hole of intrigue while solving puzzles. Although creepy at times, there are no jump scares (just fyi). Really great game that doesn't get enough attention. Highly recommend!

review_title: Don't bother for a year 2020/21 player
one_reviews_text:
I just came into the world of VR and my first experience was Half Life Alyx.  The graphics here are at least 2 generations old as in the 2017-2018 timeframe and are very hard on the eyes.  Looking through a Quest 2 headset or even on my game monitor this looks like PlayStation 1 graphics.  The controls do not feel intuitive and have been long surpassed by better games.  

If you want to see what a 2019-2020 Science Fiction VR game in space is all about I highly recommend Lone Echo instead.

So: Do I hate this game? No, in fact I would re-consider this game if it was remastered. It just is a game that is long past its prime and made for much earlier revisions of VR gear.
I purchase the game in rift but I need to purchase too with my new Quest 2? Not good idea. Please reconsideration.

The game was fun. Not the looking game but the puzzles were challenging and fun to do. My only complaint is the game is short. I knocked it out in like 3-4 hours. $25 for 3 hours of playing isn't a good deal, try to catch this one on sale.

The graphics are pretty good. The story is mysterious. The game puzzles are easy to medium difficulty. There are plenty of clues. Just take a break and go back if one stumps you. There is no action just exploration and puzzles. I hope there is an alternative ending because the ending felt like it left me hanging.

review_title: Not bad, but not great for the cost
one_reviews_text:
After playing a few other VR titles like Half Life Alyx and Lone Echo (released a few years ago now), I was a little let down a bit by this title. I'm all for Indie games, but not at premium prices. At the time of purchase, Lone Echo was just £10 more than this game, but is considerably more game for your green. 

Red Matter is OK, there's just no story to the red matter, or very little story at all. The controls and movement are a little clunky and take a bit of getting used to. Transportation would have been better than "floating" over to your next position. But I guess the longer transition was designed to add some length to the game because it isn't very long at all. 

I don't think I got more than 3 hours out of it, which for £18.99 isn't on par with what I'd expect at that price. There are no other characters in the game, the only interaction is a voice in your ear, and some spooky dude who doesn't speak. I was a fan of the old Red Faction games, this is nothing like it so don't be fooled.

There is some attention to detail, but the depth just isn't there. In Lone Echo, the planet looked like a planet, whereas here it looked more a 2D projection in a 3D space. Textures were basic throughout and the physics was a little un-natural. 

Still, it was a playable game, the puzzles weren't that difficult but lacked a little cueing here and there. I did have to check a walk through at one point, but overall, I just wish the game had more interaction and a little more of a story with a background and a much better ending as I still wasn't sure the "simulation" was, or why I had been subjected to it. 

Don't pay more than £10/$10 for this game. It just isn't worth it.

I paid 25$ for 3 hours of gameplay and a half assed ending.
I swear half of the games "puzzles" is just turning some valves and twisting some knobs.

review_title: Probably one of my rift favorites
one_reviews_text: Great storyline. Great graphics. Fun and the puzzles weren't overly challenging. I got about 6 or 7 hours of gameplay out of it but I was playing it a little slower because I was really enjoying feeling like I was really there. I remember looking out over the ridge and seeing dust fly by...there is some serious attention to detail in this game. Out of all the games I have purchased this is definately an oculus favorite for me.

I am a combat vet and have had head and neck injury so my puzzle solving skills aren't that great and I've become stuck quite a bit,the visuals are great and it is very immersive,I think this will help me out in the long run figuring things out. Excellent job on this devs, Just finished this masterpiece,it is easily now one of my favorites!

Visuals are amazing, they take care every piece of art to recreate a comunist "Russian like" starbase; puzzles are mid difficult to easy, overall story is intriguing but not fascinating, however you get stunned by the visuals and some creepy moments that really charge you up, definitely worth it.

I just finished this game and honestly, I loved it. The atmosphere was amazing, a lot of detail has gone into telling this story well, and into the art which is really pretty. I loved the fact that you had to translate everything and look for clues to solve the puzzles, and I have to say the puzzles were aimed really well: Not completely obvious, but not head-scratchingly impossible either. As a sci-fi universe, it's easy to get into (the "cold war" vibe helps to cut out a lot of unnecessary exposition). There are no real NPCs in this game, or enemies to shoot, so if you're looking for that, try Half-Life: Alyx etc. This game is for puzzlers.

The controls are nice and intuitive too, and you can wander in the game but it won't let you get too lost, which is a bonus when you're not just instantly teleporting places. The use of thrusters to move, with continuous movement instead of instant teleporting, did take a while to get used to, but I did adjust to it after a while, and I actually think that's a useful experience for a VR player as well. 

(Tips for motion sickness: a) Try imagining that you really are floating around: Face in the direction of travel as much as possible, bend your knees when you touch earth after a jump etc, and if you move slowly, the effects are a lot less; and b) repeat: do not thrust yourself backwards while standing or you might fall over as I nearly did, it's a lot more disorienting than you expect X) )

The only complaint I have about this game is that it is shorter than I might have expected, I think there's about 3, 4 hours gameplay maximum. That said, good experiences always leave you wanting more, and I would seriously buy some sort of sequel to this if one were written; it has the potential to be part of a bigger world.

I highly recommend this as a few hours of creepy fun, to newbies or veterans of VR, who are into the 'atmospheric puzzle' genre. You won't be shooting zombies or aliens here, but it's not necessarily a relaxing game!

Great VR experience, the visuals are great, love the Soviet era imagery, architecture and all that.  As a puzzle game, middle of the road, not in the class of I Expect You to Die.  Very repetitive.  Turn the power on, turn something to line up with something else.  You need a code, find the picture on the wall that has three things in the room that have numbers on the bottom and boom, your code.  Or find the thing that sticks out like a sore thumb in the room and looks like something else that sticks out like a sore thumb.  The earth-satellite bit is ridiculous.  There's no indication of how exactly precise you have to be.  I had to look up the walkthrough because I thought I had it, which I did but it didn't work, and the guy in the walkthrough had to email the company because he figured it out too but didn't know how penny ante exact it had to be.  You solve the puzzle but it doesn't work because line A is everrr so slightly off of line B.  That's the fun of video games!  The people in this game have mastered intergalactic travel but they control satellites with a circus game and a gigantic earth model.  Every thing that needs to be turned only turns with both hands and sloooooowly because that's what's fun about VR.

review_title: A great game let down only by its length
one_reviews_text: Overall a great immersive and original experience with a great story. The puzzles were not particulary hard but did take a little thought to work through. My biggest negative was that the game is too short and did not represent particuarly good value.  My game time shows 8 hours but I did leave the game running idle for  a good number of those, I would say around 3-4 hours to complete.
What a great game. Great graphics and lots of puzzles.

Shorter than I imagined but very atmospheric (if you can say that on a moon), well paced puzzles, few stumped me for a while, some more obvious perhaps. Seems linear but none the worse for that. A1 story(s) and some seriously creepy moments. Wish it had been on sale (of course) but no major regrets on buying it, spouse can have a go now......

review_title: This is what VR is made for
one_reviews_text:
One of my favorite VR games. Very immersive, intuitive controls, you really feel as though you are inside the space station.

Starting as a standard "agent infiltrates enemy base" game, over time it evolves into a psycho/mystery story that really captures the player. The puzzels are something to think about but always fair and solvable.

Pros: Excellent graphics, decent puzzle/story/exploration game if that's your cup of tea
Cons: Movement system could use a bit of tweaking, and having to scan everythign to read it is a bit tedious

Verdict: If you like puzzle/exploration games this is easy to recommend.  If not, this game likely won't change your mind.  Very nice graphics though.

review_title: Not bad just not great either
one_reviews_text: Bought this game based on reviews and the price point, and to be honest if I had paid more I would have been dissapointed, its not that the game is bad it is not, but its not great either, the graphics were just ok, there are far better looking VR titles out there as old as this that look better, the puzzles were again ok but got repetitive, restore power, push some buttons, move a lever or two, twiddle some dials..... next room, locamotion for me was very clumsy there did not seem to be smooth rotation only snap turn, which always seemed to leave me facing slightly in the wrong direction (played seated), there is also some very odd physics behaviour and lots of clipping, picked up a pot and stacked it onto another and they both clipped into each other and went flying of across the room !  also the puzzles were a bit buggy on occassion not triggering once solved also put my scanner through the peepy hole ! to scan the room on the otherside as I figured range would be an issue and it did not work leaving me stumped as to how to solve the problem, however the solution was correct I just did'nt need to reach inside the hole, such inconsistencies broke my immersion the scanner should have worked just the same whether my hand was through the hole or not, the safe puzzles also made no sense, brute forced them all, the biggest issue was that the game was just too short, 3 hours for me (only because of the picky scanner and hole debacle) it just felt like it ended just as it got interesting. So pick it up on sale just go to mars and look out of the window its worth it just for that, Cheers

Well worth the game experience! This is right in the territory of the sci-fi VR recommendations I give to others, "Get Robo Recall, Lone Echo and Red Matter"

It may be more expensive per hour than a non-VR game but AAA-quality content on the Oculus Rift is sometimes hard to find. I could have finished the game in four hours or less but I took eight hours because I was enthralled by the environment.

One suggestion to the developers (since I am a deafie) is that the subtitles could instead be displayed on the pop-up Translator Device (as an additional screen that I can also backscroll).   Looking at text on the handheld screen is better than floating subtitles -- but I am appreciative that there are subtitles in this game which is not even found in some other games (e.g. Lone Echo).  Since subtitles at least exist, there is no docked star even for an imperfect implementation of subtitles.  Everything else though, felt perfect though on a comfort/immersion perspective.

I did download and use Oculus TrayTool to force 1.6x Supersampling since that made graphics much sharper/better in Red Matter, so if any players have sufficiently powerful systems (1080 Ti Extreme or RTX 2080), they can up graphics quality via this external utility.

Oculus Store gets docked a star because it does not have a "Subtitles: Yes/No" field like SteamVR does. I heard through a friend that some group at Gallaudet University (deaf university) is considering a lawsuit to Oculus to humbly request Oculus to make a minor change to Oculus Store (a Subtitles Yes/No checkbox) to get them to at least tell deaf gamers whether a VR game has subtitles or not.

However, Five stars for Red Matter for going above-and-beyond!

Game looks terrific and performs well for the looks. Greats artwork and assets. How they got the performance for the graphics is programming wizardry. Ending is- okay--. My only issue is spending an hour on a red herring. A puzzle is much simpler than it appears. 1209. If you know this number you know which puzzle I am talking about. Awful time waste.
An exploration game as little short,, but I really enjoyed it.

review_title: Great game, perfect use of locomotion
one_reviews_text: At first I was a little off put by the eerie atmosphere in the first few minutes of the game, but if you go on you will be rewarded with a good story, decent puzzles, great visuals and the best combination of the locomotion and teleport systems I have seen yet.

Do yourself a favor and immerse yourself in crazy puzzles that challenge your logic reasoning. This is a very entertaining way to let your brain do some really fun puzzle solving. Also I completely zone out the outside world when I play this game, its really captivating. These developers did a great job.

Normally I'm not a huge puzzle fan, it's just not my thing but this game looked great. For starters, it IS very well executed with regard to imersion, interaction and clever use of the controllers, once you get used to the movement. And the environment and graphics are great.

It can be pretty rewarding to figure out the main area puzzle, however I found that in some cases the clues were just not helpful. For example, in the habitat, trying to decipher the small abstract model and the symbols on it?! Even after being shown the matching symbols, having to finally go and watch a walk-through, they still didn't make sense at all. The small art object symbols looked NOTHING like the larger sculpture. I still don't see the visual connection. I just ended up pressing the wall object as shown in the vid. This means, I'd likely never have figured it out. Same thing with the locker containing the red pawn. The EIGHT looked so much like the ZERO that I went around and around trying the combo with a zero, which of course it didn't work. When the walk-through said it was an eight, I was like, "Never mind."

I get they want to make it challenging while still rewarding but I found the clues to disconnected to work for me.

So, if you're crazy about puzzles, you'll love this game.

Truly an amazing experience, story, puzzles, even a little bit of scary stuff. Not even to mention the graphics which are 11/10. If you are looking for a detailed story with many fun and engaging puzzles this is for you! Only con is that I finished it in under 5 hours... BUT WOW!

im an old school point and click fan for me these are best experiances i have in VR, it suits the platform perfectly and this is one of the best maybe the best i have played

game has great atmophear going around abandoned space station solving puzzles fixing stuff whats not to like, i wouldnt let the short play time put you off it felt a lot longer than 3 or 4 hours in VR
Nothing else to add, just the best experience I had so far. Outstanding graphics and immersive experience!

review_title: Not nearly as good as expected
one_reviews_text:
Play time: 3 hours

Story: 2/5
Never really liked the story. I found it to be very clichéd and with a strong indie feel to it (in the bad way). Also the ending was very disappointing to me.

Gameplay: 3/5
Generally somewhat decent gameplay. The puzzles themselves were fairly logical in the literal sense but often didn't make much sense in the context - they often felt very much like artificial and simplistic game-designed puzzles and not like something you'd naturally encounter in the environment.

Visuals: 4/5
Generally beautiful visuals and well optimised (generally small indoor spaces probably helps a lot here). Lacks a bit of detail and polish here and there, though.

Controls: 2/5
The movement mechanics were weird and felt unnatural to me in the low-grav environment. Also the control layout and the way you interact with the environment is just weird. It works but feels clunky and unnatural.

Satisfaction: 2/5 (not recommended)
For the full price of $25 I really cannot recommend this game. I got it on offer for $15 and would still rather have spent them on something else.

I love Puzzle games that draw you in with things like a storyline, so when I saw this, I got it right away. I got some horror vibes from the trailer, but its really not scary. It does get creepy at some parts, but there aren't jumpscares. I love being able to scan things around me and figure out what happened. I found the storyline a bit confusing at some times, but other than that, I thought it was a great game. The experience is not THAT short, but it would be nice to see it get longer. I'm towards the end of the game (I think), and I'm already in love with it. It's totally worth it if you're into puzzle and mystery type games.

review_title: I just can't get over the visuals
one_reviews_text:
What an amazing looking game.
Not only is it an engaging, creepy puzzle game.
But I just can't stop looking at the environments, the way the lighting interacts with EVERYTHING just had me analysing the shaders and walls.
To me, this is the golden standard of VR graphical fidelity.  Amazing.

Probably the best looking VR game I've played. The lighting is beautiful and all the environments are so beautifully designed. The tone of this game is more ominous than outright scary, which is good news for those who scare easily. Puzzles weren't complex but were satisfying enough to piece together. Voice acting sadly wasn't the greatest but music was incredible. The story was cool, the pacing was great and there's a lot to be learnt by scanning the items around you. I found the ending pretty confusing, which was a shame because the story was really well told otherwise. Other than the ending, and the voice acting, it's still an amazing game and definitely woth your time. Excited to see what these devs do next!

review_title: MUST PICK if you enjoy stories & puzzles
one_reviews_text:
Very neatly done in terms of visuals and development, and puzzles hard enough to make it interesting yet not frustrating at any point. You definitely get into the story quite fast and there's a bit of tension which keeps you active while solving all the puzzles.
Is it worth the price? I'd say it is. Awesome experience. Hopefully they get to a sequel while keeping this quality standard :)

This is a very good game, the graphics, music and gameplay are excellent. The story tries to be great, but misses by a few inches (feels a little bit cliché), and the puzzles are straightforward. But overall an excellent game.

I will tell you what the only negative thing of this game COULD be - it is a bit short IF you avoid reading all the beautiful created notes, messages, letters and photographs you can find everywhere in the game. They really add a big amount of immersion and background to the story. If you skip all the love the devs have put into this gem it can be a bit short. 
Every other aspect of the game was amazing. Visuals, audio and soundtrack, story, immersion, how you use the controllers and what vr offers - everything is perfect.
To the devs at Vertical Robot: Thank you for this gem! I am still playing but it was allready the best VR experience i ever had. I will buy it on Quest too for comparison and because you deserve it. 

PS: I really hope we will see more of you all in the next years. A space game like the movie Gravity meets the game Observation would be amazing.
This game has amazing atmosphere, great story - so far -, and a well executed use of controls... I can only recommend it after getting to the buttom level of the base... get it, play it, enjoy it!!!

review_title: Very good story, but too short
one_reviews_text:
I liked the game a lot. Especially the movement belong to the best anti locomotion techniques I ever experienced.
The story really touched me.
But I took me about 2 hours to pass the game completely.
I love this game.  I wish it had cross play active.   Company is very responsive.

I really enjoyed this game, and it's one of those that show the strengths of VR. It puts you in another world and creates an atmosphere like no monitor-based game can, and then uses it to tell a story.

The gameplay is quite straightforward, in that you explore a deserted, typically cold war-esuque style base trying to work out what happened, while solving environmental puzzles along the way. Everything looks good and the puzzles themselves are good though not particularly challenging. The story itself is interesting and has a nice twist.

My only real complaint with Red Matter is it's length. Most VR games are far too short compared to their monitor-based counterparts, but this one is short even by VR standards. I explored everywhere and didn't rush anything, yet was done in around two hours. For me a game of that length just doesn't justify the price, though thankfully I picked this one up in a sale.

So overall a very good experience, but loses a star because it is much, much to short for the (full) price tag.

This is a really good looking game. Grapics, sound and music are top quality. Great. Sadly there is a really big BUT ...
The controls are from hell. I don't understand why VR developer always have to reinvent the controls over and over. It's so depressing to see such a good production quality damaged by this stupid decisions made by the developers. There is no strafe option. You can't go backwards only forward. "Free" locomotion   is possible by pressing the grip button. And there is only one direction to go - forward!! That makes navigation nerv wrecking. I quit the game after 15 minutes, because I couldn't stand this anymore. How about the good old traditional fps controls? For a change ...

I played this game straight through and was entertained the whole time.  If it was a few hours longer I would give it a five.  The puzzles ranged from easy to medium difficulty and the graphics were the strongest point of this game.  Story was decent.

This is a great game. Great graphics. Game play is great. Story line IMO was great. Hmmmm I keep using the word GREAT. Well it is!

Buy it.....you will not regret it!
I really loved this game.  The aesthetics and graphics are awesome, the story is interesting, and the puzzles are fun.  Best VR game I've played so far.

I compare every game to Lone Echo, and this one came pretty darn close. Beautiful environments, clever use of controllers, just a right amount of challenge. The only downside is the relatively short game. That, and the lack of true free locomotion (although the fusion of free locomotion and teleporting does something to enhance the getting of low gravity - pretty inventive)
review_feedback: Glad you liked the game! Just FYI, you can use smooth locomotion by pressing the grip button in addition to using the long and short range locomotion systems.

one_reviews_text:
This is solid four stars quest and puzzle mystic game. Original story idea, very immersive surrounding, good touch pad utilization. Decent graphics and sound.
Both way to move - click and jump and smooth moving. While playing you may interact with many objects, some of them you need for completing quests, some just for fun.
If you interesting in original story, puzzles and smooth gameplay this game is for you. Some puzzles may take some time to resolve ;)
It took about 9 hours to complete the game for me, but if move fast and solve puzzles more quickly you may hit the end in 4-5 hours. But i don't advice to do that - stand still sometimes and look around - game is really nice looking and has good atmosphere and a bit creepy sometimes.
I absolutely recomend this experience for anyone who like quests. Others can find high immersive into atmosphere here and take part in interesting and original story.
But do not expect action here - you will not kill anyone in this journey =)

I had to upgrade this review thanking the developers for helping me in the problem I had, their solution worked perfectly although I had to restart the game, that wasn't any poblem at all because this game is delicious, I'm leaving the commentaries I wrote before but I have to add that this game reminds me of old TV series like Lost in Space, I was 10 years old when I saw it in its debut around the end of the sixties, there was a great excitment and fear in that time because of the Russians advance in the space race and somehow this game has all that sensations, I think this incredible music helps a lot to achieve that, the images and visuals are incredible and the Ray Bradbury's ambience transmits perfectly all this deja vu, now I will leave my commentary as I wrote it yesterday before resolving the issue: "This is a great looking game, it has all the flavour of old games like Zork and so on and the music is great but I'm stuck and don't know how to solve this, if somebody could help me I would appreciate it, in the power room very near the beginnnig of the game you are required to use two circuits boards in two different slots in some kind of elevator to get to the floor below, I have done what have to be done and checked the circuits in some kind of checking machine that is near too but when I try to insert them (the circuit boards) in the slots only the lower one works , the upper one is NOT working, I have seen some walktroughs and in all of them the upper slot works eventually but in my case it NEVER works, I think is some kind of bug in the game, please could someone or the developers help me, I would greatly appreciate it"
review_feedback: Hi Cesare. First of all, thanks for your kind words about Red Matter :). Seems that you have indeed encountered a bug. We'll try to reproduce & fix this issue as fast as possible. Meanwhile the solution would be to load the entire chapter. In order to do this, go to the main menu, click on "Load Game", then select the slot you are playing in (probably slot #1), and then select "Chapter 2". This will load the chapter right after you exit the elevator. It's not ideal, because you will have to solve 2 puzzles again, but knowing the solutions to them it should not take you more than 5 minutes. We are very sorry for the inconvenience and the inmersion breaking bug. As soon as we have the fix we will release an update to prevent the possibility of future players encountering this unfortunate bug. UPDATE:The bug is already fixed :)

review_title: It’s cool but just kinda slow progress
one_reviews_text: I like the idea, but do NOT compare this to Lone Echo. They’re not even remotely the same in any way shape or form. That expectation will destroy your perception on this. It’s nice looking, the controls are pretty standard (nothing insanely frustrating — sadly, that’s the expectation now), but also, nothing insanely unique. I don’t feel like I’m blown away by anything throughout the entire game. Just sort of find myself trying to finish the thing.
It was good, the game is very immersive, unfornutately it was to short, i completed it in 2h..
Really enjoyed this game and had a great time playing through it. Some of the textures blew me away. I think I spent as much time sight seeing as figuring out the puzzles. Enjoyable storyline too.

Essentially this is just an escape room scenario. There are no interactions with other characters, just a series of  easy to moderate in difficulcty puzzles to solve. I would say that the graphic detail are okay but certainly not at the resolution or depth of Lone Echo.  The sotry line wasn't engrossing and the finale was a little underwhelming. If you enjoy Escape room type  gameplay then I would suggest a price tag of between $10-15 would be reasonble for the content.
I'm all about puzzles and this had plenty of them. Story's interesting, with a few twist. The rooms are beautifully done. Lots of oohs and aahs. Glad I made the purchase. A Solid 5.
Wow, what an intense ride! Short but super immersive, polished with a mind blowing story and a dense atmosphere.

review_title: Great Game, just a little short!
one_reviews_text:
I really got this game because I wanted to stand on Rhea and look at Saturn.

Well I did that.

The game is great, good fun with lots of puzzles that seem to be judged just right. Feels a lot like the old System Shock games which were very good.

Like others have said, it's a bit short. I completed this in 4 evenings - you're left wanting more because it's so good!

Everything about the game is so detailed, from the story, to the puzzles, and the lighting and textures.  It all makes everything so believable.  Didn't know what to expect coming in, but it was an amazing ride.

This is a fun game. The narrator keeps you on track so that you can focus on the experience. The graphics are detailed and the user interface is better than most other games like this. 

I hope to see more episodes because I would like to continue this experience.

I REALLY enjoyed this game but was hugely disappointed with the length of it. I actually find reviewers annoying when they say "it's too short" as I think sometimes they expect too much, but this is VERY short! I loved the puzzles and the atmospheric soundtrack which remided me of Total Recall (the original and not the crappy remake) but I was shocked when it ended abruptly after just a few days playing it about a couple of hours at a time.  Really hope they make some sort of sequel and put more into it.

review_title: The most enjoyable game on VR
one_reviews_text: These guys get it. The atmosphere is spot on. Just enough tension without too much fear. Plenty of chills, though. Pleasing and straightforward puzzles. Great physics. Beautiful detail. The aesthetic is also great. Man, I just finished it and you can no doubt tell I am absolutely buzzing. More of this, please, guys.
Cool game, interesting story with a twist, great graphics and audio, couple hard puzzles, it's quite short (3-4 hours tops), would wait for a sale but worth playing. Not much replay value.

Really liked it. It was challenging without being inscrutable.  Just the right degree of challenge for me. The only thing was the ending. Didn't care for that. Felt it to be a letdown after having overcome all these obstacles. Just my opinion, but I prefer to feel some modicum of success afteer having gone through hours of puozzle-solving. Other than that I really enjoyed the  game.

review_title: Such a game - Wish it was longer
one_reviews_text:
I grew up playing Zork, Myst, and 7th Guest.  Puzzle games are my absolute favorite.  And sadly that genre is all but forgotten.

This game was fantastic end to end.  The puzzles are the perfect amount of complexity that I didnt give up.  I was able to solve every one.  But unfortunatley I finished the game in maybe 3 hours total.  I only paid $20 since the game was on sale.  So I would say I got what I paid for.  Hopefully the dev's either put out some DLC or another similar game.

I really loved the thriller aspect to the game as well.  All around a great game.

A must buy. One of the best VR games I've played in a while. 
-Graphically stunning
-Good level of puzzles
-Immersive and gripping
-Lot's to interact with

Excellent all round, just stunning

Amazing game!!!, sadly is not getting the attention it deserves. But is a great game, that provides an incredible atmosphere of suspense all the time. It's not a "scare" game, but for sure it will keep you alert all the time. All the environments are well done and the graphics are very good. You'll feel immersed in a space. Some of the puzzles are not easy (or not for me) but if you are fast, the game will feel a little bit short (the only negative point). I totally love it!

review_title: Good Story, wish it was a little harder
one_reviews_text: I really liked the story, very well done. Kind of wish the puzzles were a little harder.
Great graphics, excellent immersion. Nice story. A little bit scary. A great game, thanks for this one!
This kind of games are what vr was made for. The best part is the thrilling story that is told very well using many different elements.  Also, the areas are beautiful and the puzzles are interesting.

The game looks and sounds great. The puzzles are interesting instead of hard. The story is very good. 
For me the best VR game so far.

This is a great game if you like puzzles, space and mystery. I like how the story develops, how it is told. Good voice acting. Lots of riddles. No action sequences or shooting. I would definetly buy it again.

Bought this whilst on sale and I've no regrets at all. Just completed it after 5 hours gameplay.  4 stars because of its short nature.. It really left me wanting more and an explanation of what just happened.  Thankfully there are some perceptive folks on forums to help explain it all.

 The graphics and audio are highly polished.  The smooth teleporting option is a new experience for me and I like it.. alot.

THERE IS A WEIRD TELEPORT BUG which shipped me onto the next chapter and took me by surprise...  Whilst in the area prior to the lab (chapter 4) the dog (real world) started barking to go out so I quickly put my VR to the floor to go and let her out... when I got back id been transported to Chapter 5 outside te quantum lab. How that happened i've no idea... I carried on only to find I really did need olgas Security code and got stuck in the lift without the code :(...  So went back to chapter 4 to start again... phew!

The gameplay is intuitive  as are the controllers which appear as cleverly devised multi gadget tools (with action icons), it's very easy to pick up how to navigate between them and use em.  The mechanics of the interactions with various objects has been well thought through and add to the the realism

For me it delivers on immersion and atmospherics if i'd paid full price id be feeling short changed on the amount of gameplay but its defo a bargain worth getting whilst discounted.

The story and subsequent mission tasks are challenging enough without leaving me hunting for online tips and if i'm stuck I don't mind the extra time it takes to explore for solutions.

I'm gonna say make sure you're fed and free from commitments when you load it for the first time coz you'll be wanting to spend quite some time there. I forgot how many times i was just going to get to the next problem before I quit.

This is just what I bought my VR for...

First off I thought I bought the game "Defector". Somehow I got the whole spy thing mixed up with Soviet style stuff. But anyway here goes my review.

At first the scale seems to be a little bit off.  Some objects stick out more than others. Not the end of the world but a but annoying.

Apart from that the gameplay itself is fairly interesting and keeps you going with clever little pussles that are not too easy but also not too hard.. I'm not supersampling but I can run this at High settings with my GTX 970 (including dynamic shadows etc.).

A solid 4.5/5 but I'll be nice since VR is always amazing.

I bought this in a recent sale and it only cost me £13. For that price what I got was a fun and intriguing sci fi tale with superb graphics, decent story and some interesting puzzles to solve. The game is short, maybe 3 or 4 hours to get through, but it's very stylishly done. Whilst not strictly a horror game there were a couple moments where I felt pretty uncomfortable although I am a self confessed coward in VR! At full price I'm not sure there is enough content to justify the high price but in a sale it's a great little experience.

Albeit being a short-ish game, it was truly enjoyable. I got stuck a few times and needed hints, but the solution was every time right before my nose. Music fits it perfectly. I overall love these kind of thriller/adventure games that don't have action elements to them. The pure puzzle solving works for me perfectly.

The game comes across to myself as a discovery-type game, with some plot twists that fall somewhere between a spy movie and the Twilight Zone.  The ending left me thinking of what happened, and I wound up with 2 possible conclusions (with either one being valid to a point). If you are looking for complete closure, you may be disappointed, or more likely, just smarter than I, and wondering how I could be that oblivious.
Gamelength was 5+ hours, and that was because I took my sweet time, except when I was in a rush.  So that came out to just over $5/hour of gameplay.  If I had paid $15-$20 instead, I would likely be singing its praises.  Yes, I'm cheap.
The atmosphere of the game is very well presented, and is like a steady tension, wondering if a monster is going to pop out somewhere.  The environments are very well done, both inside and outside, and gave a wonderful sense of scale and scope, similiar to playing such VR-injected games as Alien: Isolation and Doom 3 BFG.  Seeing Saturn from the moon's surface was quite the treat.
The controls are sufficient, and work well to get the job done.  Locomotion movement is similiar to the game Detached.  It was a very nice touch how the game presented the touch controllers as actual tools in the game.
When I completed the game, I was hungry for more, which to myself, is a a sign that the game did its job.  Once you finish the game, unless there are some clues or messages I missed, there is really no significant reason to go back and play it again.  Now if they had a Lone Echo exploration of the moon's surface, for example, I would go back for that.
Overall, I am not disappointed with the game, but if you try to go through the game fast, you may be disappointed by the gamelength vs. cost tradeoff.

I love these types of VR games/experiences.  Along the lines of Lone Echo and the Gallery games, Red Matter puts you in the middle of a psychological sci-fi episode, pulling you through its story via intuitive level and puzzle design.  Only thing that could be better is the movement, but the full experience is solid.
Really neat and enjoyable experience, the graphics are outstanding and the atmosphere does a great job of keeping you invested

I liked this game a lot. It can get creepy at times, but it gets better as the story continues and there is more understanding of the story. Some of the puzzles will stump you for a bit if you do not pay attention to the details.

All in all, I would reccommend this game to others.  I would definitely like to see more games like this one.  Great Game!

Everything looks and feels (!) heavy and massive and real. The rendering and lighting are extraordinary. This is the most impressive VR title I've experienced to date.

The puzzles are more of a thing to do while experiencing the world; they're not challenging. It's a little abstract and I'll be thinking about it for a while.

I've played Daedelus and hope to see more and more from this studio!

But was so disappointed when it ended! TBH...People who rush through ganes might not think the price is justified. But I took my time and explored, read, etc..and got the game on sale...so it was worth it to me. Wish there were more games out there in this adventure/puzzle genre. 

Even for a short game... on content alone, Red Matter is still a 5star...for creativity, puzzles, environment, and free-roam movement.

Hopefully the developers will release another game soon...that is 2-3x longer

If you look for a puzzle game adventure with some scary moments - thats the game. I really like it, its not Lone Echo, but still a very good game. Hopefully more games like that will come for Rift - well done !

review_title: A little bit like Zack McKracken in 3D
one_reviews_text:
not funny but the puzzles are good. Not hard and not to easy. Very good Graphik nerarly Lone Echo. Some shokes at this time but not to hard. ;). Cool Game. I like it. The handling is 4 from 5 Stars. Mysteriously feeling ..... .

I Read some comments. When I look back approximately 25 Years ago what I have payed for Zack MKracken and now I see what I have pay for one of the first VR Games in this way. I must say it is absolutly ok. I support this Games and it was a good short Game. I want more of this Games in the future ...

I'm really enjoying this game.  Puzzles are actually fun to do and the atmosphere is the best.  I'd been putting off buying this game for awhile and wish I hadn't waited.  Control is spot on, no bugs that I've encountered.  Only small gripe would be that I'd spotted something in a previous room I'd planned on looking at, totally forgot, left the room, and once I remembered I found that I can't go back.  Second playthrough required.  Overall, I'd recommend this game.

red matter puts you in an awsome world with super fun pussels and the story of the crew is very fascinating. There is a bit of horror later on in the game but  it isin't going to get you to scream and slam your oculus in one of your walls by accident. The end of the game is a bit short ended for my taste but in the end this game is one of the best vr games i have ever played.

review_title: Exactly the game I was hoping for!
one_reviews_text:
After Lone Echo I wanted more and this fit the bill perfectly.
-Interesting story, slowly piecing together what happened on this abandoned base.
- Puzzles about the right level. Not as hard as as a proper puzzle game like Talos Principle where puzzles are the whole point of the game, but rather just enough to force you think a bit, maybe for a few minutes, sometimes more, and its a balanced part of the whole experience. Got stuck twice but both times figured it out just before giving up.
- Graphics about as good as you get in VR
- Level design/art work/architecture/overall look of the base/moon all excellent
- Personally thought the locomotion and controls were fine
- Creepy unnerving atmosphere without being flat out scary
- Perfect length for me. Took me 3 good length play sessions to get through it. That for me is perfectly enough for a good VR experience. Wouldn't expect much longer, didn't feel it was short/rushed/cut short suddenly (if anything was surprised how much longer it kept going after I'd expected it was going to finish),  but then I often don't get to the end of games, and I know I'm in the minority here.

Only improvement would be, the ending (which I did like), I kind of understand what happened, roughly, but not completely. Maybe it's meant to be a figure it out yourself type thing, maybe if I think back over everything I saw I could work it out, or maybe it could be a touch more spelled out.

By its nature there's prob not much reason to play through a 2nd time once you know what's coming and have solved the mystery and puzzles, but the first play through is a fantastic experience.

One of the top VR experiences, almost up there with Lone Echo (just not quite as fun as floating in zero-g)
Its an amazing puzzle game I WANT MORE

Preordered this game before it was released after seeing the trailer - it was so intriguing. Played it over slowly, replaying some rounds multiple times just so I better understand the storyline. I've looked at everything in the game, and my twitch streams totaled nearly 7 hours (I was streaming even during the moments when I was just standing still trying to decipher what the posters say - they are in latin btw, with some letters being replaced with cyrilic or greek letters, while some being flipped upside down- and reflect on the storyline. FYI, I stream as "prometery"). Needless to say I was enjoying my experience so much that I tried to stretch it in every possible way. I even found a few bugs and had to restart the game because of them - in the first level I managed to teleport through the locked airlock door of the unpowered airlock and couldn't get out. In the habitat I managed to look through the chessboard and it triggered the door being locked behind me - so I was trapped in that room and had to restart.
The game performs well on high graphics settings on my GeForce1050Ti (a mid-range video card) with a all shadows on (including dynamic shadows).
I was confused by the abrupt ending at first, and did replay the first level (including the breefing) to beter understand it. I also replayed from the lab level through the ending several times, specifically paying attention to what the monitors say... and right before it ends the monitors display a few important messages that I find helpfull to understand the ending.

Not sure what I can say about replayability, but the fact that I replayed several levels multiple times should tell you something! I found it similar to re-reading books - while re-reading you catch details you've missed during the first read. Same is true for this game - the ending isn't 100% clear the first time you play, but replaying the game knowing the vague ending makes you pay attention to the details that you have previously dismissed.
Finally a VR game that is not a walking simulator but actually has some interesting riddles!

This is the first game I bought for my new Oculus Rift and I really enjoyed it. The puzzles were great, not too difficult to solve and the story and location were astonishing. As someone who grew up in the 80ies all that old mainframe stuff was something I liked quite a lot, although it would be much better if one could do some more puzzles with all these computers, tapes and machines that are scattered everywhere.
Now I am little bit sad that the game is over, will definitely play it again some time.

review_title: Bit too short, but worth it in sale
one_reviews_text: The story is very good, controls are fine, graphis are great.  Basically its a 5 star game, but its a bit too short.

Red Matter is a fun VR adventure game, but not up to the quality and experience of Lone Echo or Starseed Episode 2. 

The execution of this game just isn't as polished as those other titles, from the level design, to the puzzles and other things, this feels a few steps below what other similar games are offering.

It's on the shorter end of things, and not a bad ride, but I wish they did a better job with the control scheme, voice acting, and how you interact with text/reading objects. The latter felt more like a chore than an experience.

Anyway, some of the environments are very nice, and there some are solid things going for this. Worth playing, but not going out of your way to do so.

Really high quality adventure game with great graphics and puzzles. I was well and truly immersed and the storyline really pulled me in. This comes highly recommended. It took me 5 hours to complete as I really soaked in the atmosphere and explored everything.

Not Lone Echo(which is the best one) level but close. Way better than most that Steam offer. Definitely worth to buy. Little bit shorter than i wish and the ending is not the best one. But still very good game. 
Must have to every VR owner.

- Great graphics, runs smoothly on a GTX 970 with max settings
- Great setting, superb 60th sovjet style
- Good but not overwhelming gameplay
- Unnecessarily complicated input. Think you can move with the right stick smoothly? Nah, better press the grap button. Oh and grap with the trigger.
- Some parts of the location can not be visited, although they would be interesting and the story would have benefitted from them.
- Unsattisfying plot elements in the later game they would better have left out IMO and continued the story as it already went on.

Recommended for everybody who likes impressive architecture, sci fi games and can live with the absence of the great controls of Lone Echo.
Play time: ca. 3 hours

I'm a huge fan of this studio's first VR game, Daedalus (for GearVR/Oculus Go), so I had high expectations for this one. I'm happy to say I wasn't disappointed!

The movement controls took a little getting used to (in addition to teleport, you can also use the grip buttons for smooth forward motion with snap turning on the right stick; the left stick is used to select between tool options for your left hand), but I ended up not minding them terribly, though I would have prefered standard movement with the left stick, or even the ability to remap the controls entiirely. 

I explored everything, took my time, read everything, enjoyed the atmostphere, and I ended up with a play time just under 6 hours, so it's not as long a game as I would have liked, but if you don't simply zip through from one objective to the other, you should get at least 3 or 4 hours out of it (I do think the price is a bit high for that amout of content, but that seems to be a common problem with VR games in general, not Red Matter in particular). 

Because the play time is 6 hours at best (and a couple of hours at worst), the story doesn't go into as much detail as I really wanted it to, but what's there is interesting and engaging, and the puzzles fit the narrative and the environment well. There's just enough of a creepy factor to add some interest, but don't go into this expecting an outright horror game, because it's definitely not. It's more of a sci-fi themed adventure game (in the vein of Myst or Obduction) with touch of creepiness .

So my high expectations were met pretty well with this game, which means my expectations for the next one will be even higher. Don't let me down, Vertical Robot guys!

Its a great game with great graphics. Reminds me of Lone Echo in many ways which is always a good thing. But it falls short in lenth, I finished it in 4 hours and was in no way rushing. I wouldnt pass it up because of that but wait for a sale.

Excellent graphics/environments, loved the tactility of the puzzles and weight/resistence of valves/switches/etc (this title's single biggest contribution to the advancement of the genre), story was good until the ending which makes no sense (complete non-sequitor), greatly hindered by absolutely terrible controls/button mappings. Basically they tried to do something novel using the left stick as a tool selector but which then forces you to have to move using the right stick and grip triggers ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ --i.e. making everything cumbersome and less functional for no good reason. To fix: move the scanner tool and flashlight to the 'face buttons' (now unused), grabbing should *always* be with the 'grip triggers' and available *at all times* (instead of a mode you have to switch between), and locomotion (whether teleport and/or smooth) should *always* be with the 'left stick' (not right) or non-dominant-hand with a handedness toggle (have they never played a game with either a controller or kb/m before?).

This is a quite short, but quite nice story-driven puzzle game. The puzzles aren't really challenging, but the story behind it adds up for it. The game has some quite creepy sections and moments, but there are no jump-scares, and you are never in any "danger". I found this nice, as I'm not the type of person that likes being scared (especially so in VR!)
This is a nice intro-game for people who are new to VR, and has some interesting mechanics that I haven't seen before. There are two types of movement, where there's a difference between short-movement and long-movement. Short movement is the traditional blink-to-location, but long-movement is (by default) an actual thrust with jetpacks. I see some people in comments didn't enjoy this, but I found it a nice and logical way to integrate movement. And, if you didn't like it, you can just change it in the settings :)
I made a walkthrough/tutorial with permission from Vertical Robot on the game, which you can find here: https://youtu.be/zzGULMdwCrQ. Here you can see that "running" through the game takes about an hour, but if you take the time to actually involve yourself in the story, and figuring out puzzles the first time around by yourself, it probably takes closer to 3 hours (the youtube video was not my first play-through of the game...)
I recommend this game! Worth having in your library.

The controls are funky, movement is horrible and the physics are wrong.

I thought I disliked telephoning but slowly floating to my desired location, my god, is that fun...  They have attempted try to give objects a sense of weight by making your in game arms move slower than you real ones... Every object seems to have vastly different gravely, for instance paper falls faster than a big barrel. Lighting is at odds with itself, ie if you point the in game torch at an already lit area you can make it darker and the environment lighting doesn't hit objects you move around(I tried to get a better look at something I was holding but found the lights not to work) 

Couldn't really get into the story I'll try it another time if they fix the above but I doubt it. 

Got my money back/10

review_title: Not as good as in those reviews...
one_reviews_text: This is not a good game. I can't understand why it has so many good reviews. Perhaps paid players or something. Those puzzles are like reading an IQ Test Book. Story...yeah its ok. Graphics are good. But the whole game play is not that much worth. Also controls are not the best implementation. Somebody tells in reviews it would be similar to Lone Echo...really? Did this person play Lone Echo? No, the game isn't good as Lone Echo and the gameplay is absolut worse when comparing to Lone Echo.

Fantastic experience!

Visually compelling and interesting, puzzles were just right, voice acting was on point, all in all - one of my VR Must haves

I love the puzzles, I love the setting and I love the environments.   It comes with a lot of locomotion settings as well, although I think the default suits the gameplay perfectly and actually enhances the inmersion.  A no brainer for me :D

review_title: My kind of game so far
one_reviews_text: Feels like a AAA title after menu screen. This game is nicely paced for me, no stupid zombies running at me so far. Well thought out puzzles. It is simply one of my favorites mainly because of atmosphere though.  May have a tiny bit of room for improvement, but great fun regardless.

just amazing the game play and everything one of the best looking games yet.
put in free roaming and bang its the best thanks for the update now can go and have a blast cheers developer.
review_feedback: There is free locomotion available in the accessibility settings!

one_reviews_text: I really like the game. Visuals and atmosphere are great, BUT it`s too short for it`s price. I did a pretty slow playthrough, checking and reading everything, and was done after a little more than two hours. It felt like the first (maybe two) levels, and then it`s over.
Nice game. A little short and puzzles could be quite a bit harder but still worth getting it in sale.

Im not really sure what Red matter wants to be other than pretty and I mean really pretty textures and modles are crisp looking better than almost anything in vr but thats all I can really say I liked,

 if this was intended to be a puzzle game  there are far to few of them and what puzzles their are you could sleepwalk....of float semi weightlessly through your just far better off playing Xing the land beyond,

 if its a story game it's pretty bad you barely get a handfull of letters to read to understand these people were anything but vauge stereotypes bfore they died
 just play Lone Echo even the railshooter Archangle for that.

if it was truely trying to be a horor game um well it failed 100% flat on its  face in low gravity slow mo as due to their being no way to actually die in game you quickly learn you can litteraly rub your face in suposedly leathal space fungus with no repricussions.  

in the end its a game that feels like the begining a 20 hour adventure where the director pulls the blug on the project after they only complieted the first 3 hours, good only as a tech demo to show your freinds but then again thats why you have Robo Recall...you know for free.
Great experience. For such a small team, the developers did a superb job with the graphics and atmosphere.

A good puzzle game; however, very short and not exceptionally challenging.  I finished it the same day I bought it.  If you like puzzle games, it's a good buy, but I'd wait til it went on sale.  Too short for the retail price.
Adventure + puzzles + history + awesome graphics. You really get inmersed in that Volgravian base. After two years of consumer VR, developers are starting to know where is the point. 10/10.
not good for the length buy it if its ten dollars

If you like problem solving then you will like this game!  I have played it for 2 hours straight and want to keep going but can't.  Very addictive and fun game.  By the way I am 40 so if it is fun for me it has to be fun for anyone younger... :-)
Best 4 hours experience ever on VR adventure game.  Still locomotion with grip button is very wierd choice for a touch controller that have great joystick.

I'm really enjoying this game, one of the most graphically impressive games in VR. Probably the best lighting & textures in a made for VR game so far. I like the enviroments has tons of atmosphere, nice art style. I really hate teleport but i'm quite ejoying this implemetation so i didn't try game withsmooth loco. Most things are interactive. Great sound & music. Puzzles are ok not too dificult so far but interesting enough. 
Only thing i'm not keen on is sellecting the tool feels fidly, i would rather just be able to scroll through them.

Wow! Thanks God, there are a few great Game Devs out there. This Game is a must have for every Rift user. Played the first hour, enjoyed 3600 seconds!!!
Graphics 10 /10, Sound 10 / 10 , Gameplay 15 / 10. =)
Honestly! Buy it and you will love it!

It's a puzzle mystery game.
Nothing special, weak storyline, puzzles felt like a means to prolong the gameplay rather than enhance it.
It's short game, oculus says it took me 3 hours to beat.
I suppose there isn't a lot variety on oculus, so that makes the game above average, it wouldn't touch it if it wouldn't be 3D.
It's not a soul reaver on VR for story nor puzzle.

review_title: Good game, just a little short
one_reviews_text: Took me 2 hours to complete and this was reading everything and taking my time. Other than that, its a really nice looking game that plays well and has some good puzzles. Enjoyed every moment of it
Fun puzzles, not very difficult, but very immersive. Felt a bit short considering the price.

review_title: Great game, wish it was longer.
one_reviews_text: I loved the puzzle, atmosphere, story, controls, graphics.. but it was so short. :/ Maybe 3 hours? Depends how hard you find the puzzles I suppose.

review_title: Nice game but no surprises and too short
one_reviews_text: The storyline is quite linear. Puzzles are interesting, and overall graphics are nice. But it's easy to solve and so it feels like a linear FPS with puzzles instead of enemies to shoot.
There is a bug that prevents progress, this can be fixed by "restarting your PC" since mine hadn't been restarted in over a week because its on rendering when not in use. The game itself is good
review_feedback: Please get in touch with us and let us figure out what the problem is. You can drop us an email at info@verticalrobot.com

review_title: Too short, good story, no replay value
one_reviews_text: Having just finished the game and seeing a lot of positive reviews comparing it to the well polished Oculus exclusives out there...I was a little puzzled.  First of, it's just too short.  I got stuck on one puzzle for a little while with the cube matching and still beat it in under an hour and this to me nearly alone puts it at a lower category than something like Wilson's Heart or Lone Echo.  Also, GFX options are minimal and the exteriors I thought weren't as good looking as some claim, perhaps because I have a powerful PC and with high SS I see things more clearly...but the planets and enviornment are very "static" , what looked like Saturn wasn't moving at all, like a bad wall paper in VR.  The story is interesting though, for the short period it lasts, and the mechanics and puzzles were pretty good.  3/5 really is the best I would give this.
good game but puzzles too ramdom

I have to admit that I only played a tiny bit of the beginning just because I'm saving this for when I'm on vacation since it's the game I'm most excited to play,
but that says a lot right there.
If you're craving a myst or obduction like game that's space themed, here you go.

It was a pretty cool experience, except for when it's suddenly over.  It's like there was supposed to be more of a story, and then there was a rush to finish it so they tacked on a rather janky ending onto it.  Worth playing when it's on sale...but don't expect much of a complete story.

I finished this graphically stunning game (the lighting in this is phenomenal) The puzzles were well thought out. there was an ominous and spoopy atmosphere. (no jump scares at all) good sound. the only problem was that it was short... I finished it in just under 1:40.
